data.title: Tasty, efficient and good value
data.text:
I always brag to my west Los Angeles that I can easily have a full meal for less than half the cost in Monterey Park than in WLA.  This is one such restaurant that I can count on for great value. It's cafeteria style, so not a lot of ambience.
I like their xiao loong baos, pan fried dumplings, beef noodle soups, deep fried pork chop & rice and their prepared entrees and the shaved ice. I also like their watermelon juice. 
This is often my go to takeout after a long day at work.

data.title: Ideal for Take-Outs.
data.text: Whenever we need some fast and quick meal, one of our choices would be Shau May.  Our favorites - Jing Dong Meat Pie and the Pork Chop Rice.  It seems that I never get tried of their Pork Chop Rice.  It comes with Pork Chop, Rice topped with Minced Meat & Mushroom, Vegetable, Spicy Preserved Vegetable and Simmered Egg.  Our 2 grandchildren love their Taiwanese-Style Ice Slush.

data.title: cheap, pretty decent, fast service
data.text: This was my lifesaver as a student. Cheap food, that also tastes pretty good, considering the prices. They also have shaved ice which is a delicious dessert in hot weather. I usually get the 2 or 3 combo plate (comes with rice and a small bowl of clear broth) under $4. They also serve Taiwanese breakfast, which is probably my favorite. The service is not that great - the staff speak mostly Chinese. Since it's usually pretty busy, be prepared of what you want to order.

data.title: food court type, cheap boba/watermelon juice/thai tea
